p: At the outset, SARS-COVs might have a species barrier before it can be transmitted to humans. However, due to human activities, the virus has expanded its host of infection. It was found that the SARS-COV responsible for SARS-1 in 2002 existed in civet [ 32]. Viruses phylogenetically similar to SARS-COV-2 in genome sequence have now being detected in wild bats [ 26], snakes [ 33], and pangolins [ 35, 36, 37, 45].
